title: Is there a program that converts a font I've just created into an OTF or True Type?
content: I'm looking for a free way to convert the font I've just created in illustrator into an OTF or True Type file. thanks
author: capricey

comments.content:
There may be a problem with the Glyphs Mini recommendation...

“No UFO support, **no import of EPS** or SVG files.”

There may be a problem with the Glyphs Mini recommendation...

“No UFO support, **no import of EPS** or SVG files.”

Bigger problem: not free. FontForge is free - is it the only one? But AFAIK it's a bear to get to work right.

Caprice, if you can come up with $100 this  
 [http://www.fontlab.com/font-editor/typetool/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720165719/http:/www.fontlab.com/font-editor/typetool/ "http://www.fontlab.com/font-editor/typetool/")  
is worth it. And if you're a student the FontLab people have deals for you.

BTW, you haven't actually created a font yet. :-) Just a bunch of letterforms. The dark side awaits...

hhp
Moving from Illustrator to Glyphs is covered in [the Glyphs blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720165719/http:/glyphsapp.com/blog/importing-from-illustrator/).
Glyphs mini supports copy+paste from Illustrator, just not whole Illustrator-file import. Know before you speak.
Know before you speak? Hey, bub: this is the internet!
